p: The subsequent two human pandemics (1957 and 1968) were not caused by completely avian-origin viruses, but were rather reassortant viruses with avian-origin HA, PB1 polymerase and (for the 1957 pandemic) NA segments [ 33, 41– 43]. The N2 neuraminidase in the 1968 strain, however, was a continuation of the avian N2 previously introduced in the human population in 1957 [ 33]. The 2009 H1N1 ‘swine flu’ pandemic was a result of reassortment between different strains of IAV that had been circulating in swine for at least 10 years [ 44], but these precursor swine strains all had segments tracing back to avian origins some 30 years previously [ 44, 45].
